Go, go, my naughty girl, and kiss
The blooming daisy’s cheek of white;
Let laughter spill from lips of bliss
And chase the shadows from the night.

Run wild through fields where sunlight spills,
With tangled hair and sparkling eyes;
Each stolen kiss, a secret thrill,
A daring promise in disguise.

Your spirit dances, free and bold,
No rule can bind your sparkling grace.
Go, claim the world, be uncontrolled—
And leave your kisses in its place.

In my first sleep, I sailed beyond the sun,
Where rivers of quiet washed all thought away.
The world unwritten, all journeys yet begun,
I drifted, weightless, in the arms of day.

No worry marred the silence of that place,
No echo of regret, nor shadowed fear;
Just gentle currents, time’s unhurried grace,
The tender peace of innocence drawn near.

In my first sleep, the universe was whole—
A boundless sea without a shore or seam.
I woke with longing stitched into my soul,
Forever seeking that first, perfect dream.
